bfd_schema.description: Bidirectional Forwarding Detection (BFD) is a detection mechanism used uniformly on the entire network. BFD is used to rapidly detect and monitor the connectivity of links or IP routes on a network.

delay-up-timer.description: Duration during which a BFD session delays going Up. The value is expressed in seconds. By default, there is no delay when the BFD session goes Up.

mpls-passive.description: Enable/disable BFD to support the creation of an MPLS passive session. By default, such a creation is disabled.

ping-interval.description: Interval between sending LSP ping packets on a regular basis. The value is expressed in seconds.

process-mode.description: BFD deployment mode, which is configured on a logical router. The default deployment mode is distributed. If centralized is selected, the central process slot ID must be set.

process-central-slot.description: The central process slot is configured on a logical router and can be set only when BFD is deployed in centralized mode.

process-central-slot2.description: The central process slot is configured on a logical router and can be set only when BFD is deployed in centralized mode.

default-ip.description:
This address is configured on a logical router. BFD uses this address as the destination address of multicast packets.
Special explanation:
Comstraint: If BFD is enabled, the default-ip node can be configured. The value ranges from 224.0.0.107 to 224.0.0.250.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a dynamic BFD session packet.

tos-exp-static.description: Priority of static session packets. By default, the value 7 indicates the highest priority. In the case of system congestion, the BFD packets with the higher priority are sent.

basic-acl-num.description: ACL number of a BFD session.

init-wait-time.description: Specifies the initial delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. The default is 2000.

max-wait-time.description: Specifies the maximum delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. The default is 12000.

second-wait-time.description: Specifies a secondary delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. The default is 5000.

link-bundle-init-time.description: Specifies the initial delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. For bundle members, the default is 16000.

link-bundle-max-time.description: Specifies the maximum delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. For bundle members, the default is 600000.

link-bundle-second-time.description: Specifies a secondary delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. For bundle members, the default is 20000.

link-bundle-l3-mode.description: Enable/disable apply dampening, if the failure is Layer 3 (L3)-specific.

lsp-path-check.description: Enable/disable check of whether LSP path bound by BFD session mismatches. By default, it is enabled.

ipv6-trap-separated.description: Enable/disable configure the device to separately report IPv6 Up and Down traps.

session.description: Configure BFD session, which includes basic session information such as different types of sessions, local discriminator or remote discriminator of the session.

name.description: Name of a BFD session. It is the unique identifier of a BFD session and session names are case-insensitive.

admin-down.description: Enable/disable a BFD session to become admin-down. By default, this parameter is not selected. To stop BFD session detection, you can enable this parameter. If this parameter is set, the applied BFD detection mechanism is disabled. Therefore, exercise caution when performing this operation.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times that a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session Down. The detection multiplier is configured on the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

wtr-time.description: Timeout duration set on the wait-to-restore (WTR) timer. The configured value is expressed in minutes. The query value is expressed in milliseconds. By default, a BFD session does not wait for restoration. When a BFD session goes Up, the BFD session status is reported to the application after a certain period. Therefore, the WTR parameter must be set to avoid the switchover between the active and standby applications caused by session flapping. When you configure a bidirectional BFD session, it is recommended that you set the same WTR value for the two sessions.

static.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The value 7 indicates the highest priority. In the case of system congestion, BFD packets with high priorities are preferentially sent.

ip.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations for IP.

ipv4.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations for IPv4.

source-address-static-ipv4.description: Source IP address of a BFD session. Note that the source IP address is used to ensure that BFD packets are correctly forwarded when the URPF feature is enabled. The source IP address must be configured correctly because the system checks only the validity of the source IP address format. A multicast or broadcast address is invalid. If the source IP address of the outbound interface is changed after a BFD session is successfully configured, the source IP address in BFD packets is not updated. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

select-board-slot-static-ipv4.description: ID of the slot for forcible board selection.

select-board-slot2-static-ipv4.description: ID of the slot for second forcible board selection.

multicast.description: List of multicast destination address configurations.

min-tx-interval-multicast-ipv4.description: Minimum interval between sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval-multicast-ipv4.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

local-discriminator-multicast-ipv4.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the local discriminator must correspond to the remote discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

remote-discriminator-multicast-ipv4.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

out-if-name-multicast-ipv4.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. If only the destination IP address is specified, multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

process-pst-multicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable update the PST when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

pis-multicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable update the PIS when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

pis-sub-if-multicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable associate the sub-interface when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

dot1q-vid-multicast-ipv4.description: VLAN ID of a dot1q termination sub-interface.

qinq-pe-vid-multicast-ipv4.description: Outer VLAN ID of a QinQ termination sub-interface.

qinq-ce-vid-multicast-ipv4.description: Inner VLAN ID of a QinQ termination sub-interface.

cipher-string-multicast-ipv4.description: SHA1 authentication password. 1 to 20 characters for simple text or 20 to 148 characters for ciphertext.

negotiation-timeout-multicast-ipv4.description: BFD negotiation timeout period, in seconds. After a BFD negotiation timeout period is configured, the BFD negotiation timeout timer is started when the BFD session goes Down (the event is not triggered through detecting a link fault). If the timer has expired but the BFD session is still Down, the service associated with the BFD session is notified of the BFD session Down event.

unicast.description: List of unicast destination address configurations.

min-tx-interval.description: Minimum interval between sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-echo-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval between receiving one-arm echo session packets.

local-discriminator.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the local discriminator must correspond to the remote discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

remote-discriminator.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

out-if-name-static-unicast-ipv4.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. If only the destination IP address is specified, multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

is-set-track-if-static-ipv4.description: Enable/disable a BFD session to track an AC interface.

track-if-name-static-ipv4.description: Name of the interface tracked by a BFD session.

process-pst-static-unicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable update the PST when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

destination-address-static-unicast-ipv4.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

vrf-name-static-unicast-ipv4.description: Name of the VPN to which a BFD session belongs. If the VPN name is not specified, the destination IP address is considered as a public network address. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

one-arm-echo-static-unicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable echo session in one-arm mode, one-arm-echo must be configured for one-arm session type.

one-arm-echo-destination-address-static-.description: Destination IP address of a one arm echo mode BFD session.

per-link-static-unicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable detect member links of the primary link.

ipv6.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations for IPv6.

select-board-slot-static-ipv6.description: ID of the slot for forcible board selection for IPv6.

select-board-slot2-static-ipv6.description: ID of the slot for second forcible board selection for IPv6.

min-rx-interval-static-ipv6.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-echo-rx-interval-static-ipv6.description: Minimum interval between receiving one-arm echo session packets.

remote-discriminator-static-ipv6.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

destination-address-static-ipv6.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

source-address-static-ipv6.description: Source IP address of a BFD session. This parameter must be configured when a static BFD session with automatically negotiated discriminators is created. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is IP. Note that the source IP address is used to ensure that BFD packets are correctly forwarded when the URPF feature is enabled. The source IP address must be configured correctly because the system checks only the validity of the source IP address format. A multicast or broadcast address is invalid. If the source IP address of the outbound interface is changed after a BFD session is successfully configured, the source IP address in BFD packets is not updated. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

track-if-name-static-ipv6.description: Name of the interface tracked by a BFD session.

one-arm-echo-static-ipv6.description: Enable/disable echo session in one-arm mode, one-arm-echo must be configured for one-arm session type.

one-arm-echo-destination-address-static-.description: Destination IP address of a one arm echo mode BFD session. This parameter is available only when the session is One-Arm Echo mode.

process-pst-static-ipv6.description: Enable/disable update the PST when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

remote-discriminator-static-ldp-lsp.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. local-discriminator-static-te-lsp.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the local discriminator must correspond to the remote discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

remote-discriminator-static-te-lsp.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

tunnel-name-static-te-lsp.description: Name of a RSVP TE tunnel.

te-backup-lsp-static-te-lsp.description: Enable/disable the LSP to be the primary LSP in a tunnel.

one-arm-echo-static-te-lsp.description: Enable/disable echo session in one-arm mode, one-arm-echo must be configured for one-arm session type.

process-pst-static-te-lsp.description: Enable/disable to update the PST when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

min-rx-interval-static-te-tunnel.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

local-discriminator-static-te-tunnel.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the local discriminator must correspond to the remote discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

remote-discriminator-static-te-tunnel.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

one-arm-echo-static-te-tunnel.description: Enable/disable echo session in one-arm mode, one-arm-echo must be configured for one-arm session type.

select-board-slot-static-te-tunnel.description: ID of the slot for forcible board selection.

process-pst-static-te-tunnel.description: Enable/disable to update the PST when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

If only the destination IP address is specified, multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

pis-auto-ipv4.description: Enable/disable update the PIS when the status of a BFD IPv4 auto session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

pis-no-impact-auto-ipv4.description: Enable/disable impact on reboot for a BFD IPv4 auto session.

te-backup-lsp-auto-te-lsp.description: Enable/disable the LSP to be the primary LSP in a tunnel. By default, the LSP is the primary LSP. This parameter is available when the type of the detected link is TE LSP.

sub-local-discriminator.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session. When the BFD session is created in static auto-negotiation mode, you do not need to set this parameter. Note that the local discriminator must correspond to the remote discriminator on the peer of the BFD session. That is, the value of the local discriminator must be the same as the value of the remote discriminator.

bgp-tunnel-session-num.description: Number of BFD sessions of the BGP tunnel type.

vxlan-session-num.description: Number of BFD sessions of the VXLAN type.

srbe-tunnel-session-num.description: Number of BFD sessions of the SR-BE tunnel type.

main-session-up-num.description: Number of BFD main sessions that are in the Up state.

main-session-down-num.description: Number of BFD main sessions that are in the Down state.

sub-session-up-num.description: Number of BFD sub sessions that are in the Up state.

sub-session-down-num.description: Number of BFD sub sessions that are in the Down state.

used-bfd-res-num.description: Number of BFD resources in use.

max-bfd-res-num.description: Maximum number of BFD resources supported by a device.

max-crc-session-num.description: Maximum number of BFD sessions for bit error detection supported by a device.

current-crc-session-num.description: Current number of BFD sessions for bit error detection.

sid-list-session-num.description: Number of BFD sessions of the segment list type.

sbfd-ref-session-num.description: Number of S-BFD sessions established on a reflector.

p2mp-session-num.description: Number of BFD for P2MP sessions.

all-sessions.description: List of all BFD sessions, including the statically configured sessions and dynamically generated sessions.

all-session.description: Statistics of information about all BFD sessions, including the statically configured sessions and dynamically generated sessions.

create-type.description: Type for creating a BFD session.

local-discriminator.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session.

remote-discriminator.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session.

link-type.description: Type of the link detected by a BFD session.

destination-address.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is IP or LDP LSP.

source-address.description: Source IP address of a BFD session.

next-hop.description: Next hop IP address of a BFD session.

out-if-name.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is IP or LDP LSP. If only the destination IP address is specified, multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

vrf-name.description: Name of the VPN to which a BFD session belongs. If the VPN name is not specified, the destination IP address is considered as a public network address.

tunnel-name.description: Name of a TE tunnel. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is TE LSP or TE Tunnel.

te-backup.description: Flag of determining whether an LSP link is a backup TE LSP.

min-tx-interval.description: Minimum interval between sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times that a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session Down. The detection multiplier is configured on the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

demand-enable.description: Indicate whether to enable the demand mode for a BFD session.

wtr-timer-int.description: Timeout duration set on the wait-to-restore (WTR) timer. The value 0 indicates that a BFD session does not wait for restoration.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The default value is 7, indicating the highest priority.

shut-down.description: Indicate whether a BFD session becomes AdminDown.

config-pst.description: Flag of determining whether to configure the PST when the status of a BFD session changes.

pis.description: Flag of determining whether to update the PIS when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

bind-application.description: Information about the application to which a BFD session is bound.

fsm-board-slot.description: Number of board selection for a BFD session.

dot1q-vid.description: VLAN ID of a dot1q termination sub-interface.

qinq-pe-vid.description: Outer VLAN ID of a QinQ termination sub-interface.

qinq-ce-vid.description: Inner VLAN ID of a QinQ termination sub-interface.

echo-passive.description: Enabling state of a passive echo session.

basic-acl-num.description: Number of ACLs for a BFD session.

min-echo-rx-int.description: Minimum interval between receiving one-arm echo session packets.

running.description: Statistics of running information of the BFD session contains the session name, status, TX interval, RX interval, detection time multiplier and other information.

udp-destination-port.description: Destination port number of the UDP packets transmitted in a BFD session.

detect-mode.description: Actual detection mode for a BFD session.

remote-demand-mode.description: Whether the remote end of a BFD session is in demand mode.

create-type.description: Type for creating a BFD session.

link-type.description: Type of the link detected by a BFD session.

destination-address.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of link detection is IP and LDP LSP.

source-address.description: Source IP address of a BFD session.

fsm-board-slot.description: Number of board selection for a BFD session.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The value ranges from 0 to 6. By default, the value 6 indicates the highest priority. In the case of system congestion, the BFD packets with the higher priority are sent.

min-tx-interval.description: Minimum interval for sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval for receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times when a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session as Down. The detection multiplier is configured by the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

act-tx-interval.description: Actual interval for sending packets in a BFD session.

act-rx-interval.description: Actual interval for receiving packets in a BFD session.

act-detect-multiplier.description: Actual detection multiplier for determining whether a BFD session is Down.

detect-time.description: Detection interval when a BFD session is in asynchronism mode.

dest-port.description: Destination port number of the UDP packets transmitted in a BFD session.

wtr-timer-int.description: Timeout duration set on the wait-to-restore (WTR) timer. Value 0 indicates that a BFD session does not wait for restoration.

local-diag.description: Reason why a BFD session becomes Down last time.

bind-application.description: Information about the binding application of a BFD session.

out-if-name.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of detected link is IP or LDPLSP. If only the destination IP address is specified, it indicates that multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, it indicates that single hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

vrf-name.description: Name of the VPN to which a BFD session belongs. If the VPN name is not specified, the destination IP address is considered as a public network address.

te-backup.description: Flag of determining whether an LSP link is a backup TE LSP.

pw-secondary.description: Flag of determining whether a PW is a secondary PW.

delay-up-timer.description: Duration during which a BFD session delays going Up. The value is expressed in seconds. By default, there is no delay when the BFD session goes Up.

mpls-passive.description: Enable/disable BFD to support the creation of an MPLS passive session. By default, such a creation is disabled.

ping-interval.description: Interval between sending LSP ping packets on a regular basis. The value is expressed in seconds.

process-mode.description: BFD deployment mode, which is configured on a logical router. The default deployment mode is distributed. If centralized is selected, the central process slot ID must be set.

process-central-slot.description: The central process slot is configured on a logical router and can be set only when BFD is deployed in centralized mode.

process-central-slot2.description: The central process slot is configured on a logical router and can be set only when BFD is deployed in centralized mode.

default-ip.description:
This address is configured on a logical router. BFD uses this address as the destination address of multicast packets.
Special explanation:
Comstraint: If BFD is enabled, the default-ip node can be configured. The value ranges from 224.0.0.107 to 224.0.0.250.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a dynamic BFD session packet.

tos-exp-static.description: Priority of static session packets. By default, the value 7 indicates the highest priority. In the case of system congestion, the BFD packets with the higher priority are sent.

basic-acl-num.description: ACL number of a BFD session.

init-wait-time.description: Specifies the initial delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. The default is 2000.

max-wait-time.description: Specifies the maximum delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. The default is 12000.

second-wait-time.description: Specifies a secondary delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. The default is 5000.

link-bundle-init-time.description: Specifies the initial delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. For bundle members, the default is 16000.

link-bundle-max-time.description: Specifies the maximum delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. For bundle members, the default is 600000.

link-bundle-second-time.description: Specifies a secondary delay in milliseconds before starting a BFD session. For bundle members, the default is 20000.

link-bundle-l3-mode.description: Enable/disable apply dampening, if the failure is Layer 3 (L3)-specific.

lsp-path-check.description: Enable/disable check of whether LSP path bound by BFD session mismatches. By default, it is enabled.

ipv6-trap-separated.description: Enable/disable configure the device to separately report IPv6 Up and Down traps.

session.description: Configure BFD session, which includes basic session information such as different types of sessions, local discriminator or remote discriminator of the session.

name.description: Name of a BFD session. It is the unique identifier of a BFD session and session names are case-insensitive.

admin-down.description: Enable/disable a BFD session to become admin-down. By default, this parameter is not selected. To stop BFD session detection, you can enable this parameter. If this parameter is set, the applied BFD detection mechanism is disabled. Therefore, exercise caution when performing this operation.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times that a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session Down. The detection multiplier is configured on the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

wtr-time.description: Timeout duration set on the wait-to-restore (WTR) timer. The configured value is expressed in minutes. The query value is expressed in milliseconds. By default, a BFD session does not wait for restoration. When a BFD session goes Up, the BFD session status is reported to the application after a certain period. Therefore, the WTR parameter must be set to avoid the switchover between the active and standby applications caused by session flapping. When you configure a bidirectional BFD session, it is recommended that you set the same WTR value for the two sessions.

static.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The value 7 indicates the highest priority. In the case of system congestion, BFD packets with high priorities are preferentially sent.

ip.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations for IP.

ipv4.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations for IPv4.

source-address-static-ipv4.description: Source IP address of a BFD session. Note that the source IP address is used to ensure that BFD packets are correctly forwarded when the URPF feature is enabled. The source IP address must be configured correctly because the system checks only the validity of the source IP address format. A multicast or broadcast address is invalid. If the source IP address of the outbound interface is changed after a BFD session is successfully configured, the source IP address in BFD packets is not updated. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

select-board-slot-static-ipv4.description: ID of the slot for forcible board selection.

select-board-slot2-static-ipv4.description: ID of the slot for second forcible board selection.

multicast.description: List of multicast destination address configurations.

min-tx-interval-multicast-ipv4.description: Minimum interval between sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval-multicast-ipv4.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

local-discriminator-multicast-ipv4.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the local discriminator must correspond to the remote discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

remote-discriminator-multicast-ipv4.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

out-if-name-multicast-ipv4.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. If only the destination IP address is specified, multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

process-pst-multicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable update the PST when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

pis-multicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable update the PIS when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

pis-sub-if-multicast-ipv4.description: Enable/disable associate the sub-interface when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

dot1q-vid-multicast-ipv4.description: VLAN ID of a dot1q termination sub-interface.

qinq-pe-vid-multicast-ipv4.description: Outer VLAN ID of a QinQ termination sub-interface.

qinq-ce-vid-multicast-ipv4.description: Inner VLAN ID of a QinQ termination sub-interface.

cipher-string-multicast-ipv4.description: SHA1 authentication password. 1 to 20 characters for simple text or 20 to 148 characters for ciphertext.

negotiation-timeout-multicast-ipv4.description: BFD negotiation timeout period, in seconds. After a BFD negotiation timeout period is configured, the BFD negotiation timeout timer is started when the BFD session goes Down (the event is not triggered through detecting a link fault). If the timer has expired but the BFD session is still Down, the service associated with the BFD session is notified of the BFD session Down event.

unicast.description: List of unicast destination address configurations.

min-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

remote-discriminator.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the BFD session.

out-if-name-static-unicast-ipv4.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. If only the destination IP address is specified, multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

source-address-auto-ipv4.description: Source IP address of a BFD session. Note that the source IP address is used to ensure that BFD packets are correctly forwarded when the URPF feature is enabled. The source IP address must be configured correctly because the system checks only the validity of the source IP address format. A multicast or broadcast address is invalid. If the source IP address of the outbound interface is changed after a BFD session is successfully configured, the source IP address in BFD packets is not updated. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

Note that the local discriminator must correspond to the remote discriminator on the peer of the BFD session. That is, the value of the local discriminator must be the same as the value of the remote discriminator.

sub-remote-discriminator.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. When the BFD session is created in static auto-negotiation mode, you do not need to set this parameter. running.description: Statistics of running information of the BFD session contains the session name, status, TX interval, RX interval, detection time multiplier and other information.

udp-destination-port.description: Destination port number of the UDP packets transmitted in a BFD session.

sub-remote-discriminator.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. When the BFD session is created in static auto-negotiation mode, you do not need to set this parameter. name.description: Name of a BFD session. It is the unique identifier of a BFD session and session names are case-insensitive.

admin-down.description: Enable/disable a BFD session to become admin-down. By default, this parameter is not selected. To stop BFD session detection, you can enable this parameter. If this parameter is set, the applied BFD detection mechanism is disabled. Therefore, exercise caution when performing this operation.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times that a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session Down. The detection multiplier is configured on the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

wtr-time.description: Timeout duration set on the wait-to-restore (WTR) timer. The configured value is expressed in minutes. The query value is expressed in milliseconds. By default, a BFD session does not wait for restoration. When a BFD session goes Up, the BFD session status is reported to the application after a certain period. Therefore, the WTR parameter must be set to avoid the switchover between the active and standby applications caused by session flapping. When you configure a bidirectional BFD session, it is recommended that you set the same WTR value for the two sessions.

static.description: List of BFD statistic session configurations.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The value 7 indicates the highest priority. In the case of system congestion, BFD packets with high priorities are preferentially sent.

pis-auto-ipv4.description: Enable/disable update the PIS when the status of a BFD IPv4 auto session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

pis-no-impact-auto-ipv4.description: Enable/disable impact on reboot for a BFD IPv4 auto session.

ipv6.description: List of BFD auto session configurations for IPv6.

min-tx-interval-auto-ipv6.description: Minimum interval between sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval-auto-ipv6.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

destination-address-auto-ipv6.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

source-address-auto-ipv6.description: Source IP address of a BFD session. Note that the source IP address is used to ensure that BFD packets are correctly forwarded when the URPF feature is enabled. The source IP address must be configured correctly because the system checks only the validity of the source IP address format. A multicast or broadcast address is invalid. If the source IP address of the outbound interface is changed after a BFD session is successfully configured, the source IP address in BFD packets is not updated. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

vrf-name-auto-ipv6.description: Name of the VPN to which a BFD session belongs. If the VPN name is not specified, the destination IP address is considered as a public network address. This parameter cannot be modified or deleted after a BFD session is configured. If you need to modify or delete this parameter, delete the BFD session and reconfigure the session.

select-board-slot-auto-ipv6.description: ID of the slot for forcible board selection for IPv6.

select-board-slot2-auto-ipv6.description: ID of the slot for second forcible board selection for IPv6.

bundle-mode-auto-ipv6.description: Mode of Link-bundle session, 'none': not bundle mode; 'Bundle_Standard': RFC7310 mode; 'Bundle_Compatible': mode of connection with other company.

pis-auto-ipv6.description: Enable/disable update the PIS when the status of a BFD IPv6 auto session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

pis-no-impact-auto-ipv6.description: Enable/disable impact on reboot for a BFD IPv6 auto session.

tunnel-name-auto-te-lsp.description: Name of a RSVP TE tunnel.

te-backup-lsp-auto-te-lsp.description: Enable/disable the LSP to be the primary LSP in a tunnel. By default, the LSP is the primary LSP. This parameter is available when the type of the detected link is TE LSP.

process-pst-auto-te-lsp.description: Enable/disable to update the PST when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

link-type.description: Type of the link detected by a BFD session.

destination-address.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is IP or LDP LSP.

source-address.description: Source IP address of a BFD session.

next-hop.description: Next hop IP address of a BFD session.

out-if-name.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is IP or LDP LSP. If only the destination IP address is specified, multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, single-hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

vrf-name.description: Name of the VPN to which a BFD session belongs. If the VPN name is not specified, the destination IP address is considered as a public network address.

tunnel-name.description: Name of a TE tunnel. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is TE LSP or TE Tunnel.

te-backup.description: Flag of determining whether an LSP link is a backup TE LSP.

min-tx-interval.description: Minimum interval between sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times that a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session Down. The detection multiplier is configured on the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

demand-enable.description: Indicate whether to enable the demand mode for a BFD session.

wtr-timer-int.description: Timeout duration set on the wait-to-restore (WTR) timer. The value 0 indicates that a BFD session does not wait for restoration.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The default value is 7, indicating the highest priority.

shut-down.description: Indicate whether a BFD session becomes AdminDown.

config-pst.description: Flag of determining whether to configure the PST when the status of a BFD session changes.

pis.description: Flag of determining whether to update the PIS when the status of a BFD session changes. On each interface, only one BFD session can be set for this parameter.

local-discriminator.description: Local discriminator of a BFD session.

create-type.description: Type for creating a BFD session.

session-type.description: Type of a BFD session, including single-/multi-hop IP, LSP, tunnel, and TE LSP.

remote-discriminator.description: Remote discriminator of a BFD session. When the BFD session is created in static auto-negotiation mode, you do not need to set this parameter. Note that the remote discriminator must correspond to the local discriminator on the peer of the session. That is, the value of the remote discriminator must be the same as the value of the local discriminator.

link-type.description: Type of the link detected by a BFD session.

destination-address.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of the detected link is IP or LDP LSP.

min-tx-interval.description: Minimum interval between sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval between receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times that a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session Down. The detection multiplier is configured on the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The default value is 7, indicating the highest priority.

bind-application.description: Information about the application to which a BFD session is bound.

fsm-board-slot.description: Number of board selection for a BFD session.

multi-cast-session-running.description: Statistics of running information about a BFD session.

udp-dst-port.description: Destination port number of the UDP packets transmitted in a BFD session.

detect-mode.description: Actual detection mode for a BFD session.

re-demand-mode.description: Whether the remote end of a BFD session is in demand mode.

act-tx-interval.description: Actual interval between sending packets in a BFD session.

act-rx-interval.description: Actual interval between receiving packets in a BFD session.

act-multiplier.description: Actual detection multiplier for determining whether a BFD session is Down.

detect-time.description: Detection interval when a BFD session is in asynchronous mode.

ttl.description: Time to live (TTL) value of BFD packets.

tx-timer-id.description: Sending timer of a BFD session.

init-timer-id.description: Init timeout timer of a BFD session.

wtr-timer-id.description: WTR timer of a BFD session.

not-up-reason.description: Reason why a BFD session cannot become Up.

acl-num.description: Number of ACLs for a BFD session.

local-diag.description: Reason why a BFD session becomes Down last time.

echo-tx-timer-id.description: Sending timer of a BFD session with Echo.

detect-mode.description: Actual detection mode for a BFD session.

create-type.description: Type for creating a BFD session.

link-type.description: Type of the link detected by a BFD session.

destination-address.description: Destination IP address of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of link detection is IP and LDP LSP.

source-address.description: Source IP address of a BFD session.

fsm-board-slot.description: Number of board selection for a BFD session.

tos-exp.description: Priority of a packet. The value ranges from 0 to 6. By default, the value 6 indicates the highest priority. In the case of system congestion, the BFD packets with the higher priority are sent.

min-tx-interval.description: Minimum interval for sending packets, which is set for a BFD session.

min-rx-interval.description: Minimum interval for receiving packets, which is set for a BFD session.

detect-multiplier.description: Number of times when a BFD session continuously detects that packets are sent but no response is returned and then the system considers the BFD session as Down. The detection multiplier is configured by the systems at both ends of the BFD session and does not need to be negotiated.

act-tx-interval.description: Actual interval for sending packets in a BFD session.

act-rx-interval.description: Actual interval for receiving packets in a BFD session.

act-detect-multiplier.description: Actual detection multiplier for determining whether a BFD session is Down.

detect-time.description: Detection interval when a BFD session is in asynchronism mode.

dest-port.description: Destination port number of the UDP packets transmitted in a BFD session.

wtr-timer-int.description: Timeout duration set on the wait-to-restore (WTR) timer. Value 0 indicates that a BFD session does not wait for restoration.

local-diag.description: Reason why a BFD session becomes Down last time.

bind-application.description: Information about the binding application of a BFD session.

out-if-name.description: Name of the outbound interface of a BFD session. This parameter is available only when the type of detected link is IP or LDPLSP. If only the destination IP address is specified, it indicates that multi-hop routes are detected. If both the destination IP address and outbound interface name are specified, it indicates that single hop links are detected. That is, a fixed route is detected, with the interface where the BFD session resides as the outbound interface and the destination IP address as the next hop address.

vrf-name.description: Name of the VPN to which a BFD session belongs. If the VPN name is not specified, the destination IP address is considered as a public network address.

te-backup.description: Flag of determining whether an LSP link is a backup TE LSP.

pw-secondary.description: Flag of determining whether a PW is a secondary PW.
